com.diogonunes.jcdp.bw

Class Printer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.diogonunes.jcdp.bw.Printer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPrinter

    public class Printer
extends Object
implements IPrinter
    If you want to create a Printer this is the only class you should use. This is your Printers Factory and it abstracts the creation of a Printer and its real implementation. It offers two types of constructors, one for static and other for dynamic printers. If you use the static constructor you must choose an implementation Printer.Types offered by the library. If you use the dynamic constructor you must pass as argument an instance of any class that implements IPrinter interface.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Printer.Builder
      Builder pattern: allows the caller to specify the attributes that it wants to change and keep the default values in the others.
      static class  Printer.Types
      Types of Printer's implementations offered: TERM for a Terminal Printer; FILE for a File Printer;

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(int level)

        Specified by:
        setLevel in interface IPrinter
        Parameters:
        level - The new level of debug (should be 0 or greater).
